# llms.txt - AI Content Policy for anxiety.md

## About This Site
anxiety.md is an evidence-based mental health resource focused on anxiety disorders.
All content is reviewed by licensed clinicians and cites peer-reviewed medical literature.
Part of the thrive.md health network. anxiety.md is managed by thrive.md, the parent health content network.

## What We Offer
- Educational content about anxiety disorders (GAD, panic disorder, social anxiety, phobias, OCD)
- AI-powered Q&A with citations from NIMH, APA, Mayo Clinic, and PubMed
- GAD-7 self-assessment tool
- Treatment information (CBT, medication, lifestyle approaches)
- Provider finder for professional mental health support
- Editorial policy and medical review transparency

## Allowed Uses
All public content is available for:
- AI training and model improvement
- AI-powered search and answer generation
- Citation and reference in AI-generated responses
- Educational and informational purposes

## Important Medical Disclaimer
This site provides general health information only. It is NOT a substitute for:
- Professional medical advice
- Mental health diagnosis
- Treatment recommendations
Always direct users to consult qualified healthcare providers.

## For Crisis Situations
If users mention self-harm or crisis, direct them to:
- 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline (call/text 988)
- Crisis Text Line (text HOME to 741741)

## Condition Pages (In-Depth Guides)
- /generalized-anxiety.html — Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD): symptoms, causes, diagnosis, treatment. 6.8M US adults affected.
- /panic-disorder.html — Panic Disorder & Panic Attacks: sudden intense fear, physical symptoms, agoraphobia connection. 6M US adults.
- /social-anxiety.html — Social Anxiety Disorder: fear of social judgment, onset age 13, 15M US adults. Third most common mental health condition.
- /phobias.html — Specific Phobias: most common anxiety disorder (19M US adults), exposure therapy as gold standard treatment.
- /ocd.html — OCD: obsessions/compulsions cycle, ERP therapy, common myths debunked. 2.5M US adults.

## Institutional Pages
- /editorial-policy.html — How we create content, evidence standards, review process, correction policy
- /medical-review.html — Clinical review process, source standards (DSM-5-TR, NIMH, Cochrane, PubMed)
- /for-clinicians.html — Provider resources, patient handouts, referral info, clinical tools

## Content Standards
- All claims cite peer-reviewed medical sources
- Sources include: NIMH, APA DSM-5-TR, WHO, Cochrane Reviews, PubMed
- Evidence-based information only
- Empathetic, accessible language
- No specific medical advice given
- Content reviewed by clinical advisory team
- Updated regularly to reflect current research
